abstract: Comcast has appealed a ruling by the Federal Communications Commission that objected to the way the cable company had slowed down the connection of some users who were trying to share video and other files. Comcast is questioning whether the commission had the authority to impose sanctions since regulators hadn’t published a formal rule setting standards for traffic management.

lead_paragraph: Comcast made no secret of its interest in challenging the Federal Communications Commission’s order  in August sanctioning the cable company for how it impeded the Internet connections of some customers as they were trying to share files over the Internet.
